line_1: And Scotsmen reap what they disdain'd to sow;
line_2: For our advantage shall their harvests grow,

line_1: She taught to yoke th' unwilling Ox, to sow
line_2: The harrow'd Ridge, to hold the bending Plough;

line_1: Miss Kitty learns to read, Miss Jean to sow.
line_2: And now to school the fancied children go,

line_1: 'Tis but a Grain of Sweetness they can Sow,
line_2: And reap the long sad Harvest of Immortal Woe.

line_1: Here well-weigh'd Words with wary Foresight sow,
line_2: For all you say will sink, and ev'ry Seed will grow.

line_1: Spontaneous, take but little pains to sow,
line_2: But we, as if good qualities would grow

line_1: With a rich saddle decorate a sow,
line_2: Well Burgum, take thy laurel to thy brow;

line_1: There Seeds of Science carefully they sow,
line_2: Here cultivate the Soil, to make 'em grow,

line_1: Our wholsome grain we vainly sow,
line_2: Spite of our Art the Tares will grow,
